constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Alteration to fenestration and installation of 8 nos side rooflights
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development must be carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Fire Strategy Report prepared by OPS Chartered Surveyors dated June 2022 unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates the necessary fire safety measures in accordance with the Mayor's London Plan Policy D12.

All rooflights hereby permitted shall be conservation style rooflights set as flush as practicable within the roof slope.Reason: To ensure the development preserves the character and appearance of the Conservation Area

The 3 windows hereby approved on the front elevation shall be installed so that they match the details and window reveals / set back of the Neighbouring Property (No 144) and they shall be constructed from timber frames. Reason: To ensure the development preserves the character and appearance of the Conservation Area
